item.description:
We'll have an open forum at January's meeting. If you have any topics you'd like to suggest, please let me know.

Here are some "mini-topics" to warm us up:

    *If Scott attends, he can tell us about his trip to the "Amazing! Meeting" in Australia.
    *This article in Time magazine on climate change and climate-change skeptics contains many facts and links to the "stubborn debate over climate change" wherein the season's massive snowstorms cause climate-change skepticism.


What to expect: This monthly meeting typically begins with an introduction all around for the benefit of any first-time attendees, and discussion of any announcements, upcoming events, etc. We then move on to a topic of interest to atheists (usually) chosen beforehand. Sometimes participants bring print-outs of articles, research, or books to share on the topic, and sometimes people just come with a story or opinion to share.

We loosely moderate the topical discussion to give everyone a chance to participate. Then the conversation often flows onto other related subjects, sometimes in smaller conversation groups around the table.

If you have any ideas for meeting topics, please let any of the co-organizers know. We can also add announcements or "mini-topics" on the agenda if there's anything you'd like to share with the group.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the large group, some might be wearing atheistic shirts
item.name: Sunday Morning Topical Meeting--Open Forum/Global Climate Change
